response.original_title: Funny Bones: Posada and His Day of the Dead Calaveras
response.overview: Funny Bones tells the story of how calaveras came to be. The amusing figures are the creation of Mexican artist José Guadalupe (Lupe) Posada (1852–1913). Lupe learned the art of printing at a young age and soon had his own shop. In a country that was not known for freedom of speech, he drew political cartoons, much to the amusement of the local population but not to the politicians.
response.title: Funny Bones: Posada and His Day of the Dead Calaveras
